title: Do you think 90,000 Americans would have died if we hadn't elected a game show host for president? - Quora

response.answer_text: Trump was a reality show host, not a game show host, and he’s rather turned the national discourse into a reality TV show. I agree with Barack Obama, who said: It would have been bad even with the best of governments. It has been an absolute chaotic disaster when that mindset of 'what's in it for me' and 'to heck with everybody else' ... is operationalized in our government. That first part is undoubtedly true, just look at the rest of the world without Donald Trump. But the second part is also true when we consider the US being slow to start testing. Testing is what allowed South Korea to survive the crisis with far lower casualty rates and without having to shut down their society. Testing was South Korea’s great success story, and Trump calls testing “overrated.” I think it would be arrogant for anyone to say with any certainty what the casualty numbers in the US would be today with a different president, say Hillary Clinton or Joe Biden. But that guy who died after drinking aquarium purifier because it said Chloroquine on the label, would still be alive.[1] Footnotes[1] https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/03/24/coronavirus-chloroquine-poisoning-death/

If the incredible Democrats had had someone like the exalted Andy Cuomo, or Phil Murphy, as president, we might have had 250,000 dead by now. How brilliant were they to put patients infected with COVID-19 into nursing homes? True greatness on display by Democrats, folks!! Another question - for the Trump haters - where would the death tally be if those Democrats hadn’t done stupid on such a large scale? Nancy Pelosi out in Chinatown? DeBlahblahblah telling people to go see a show? Purposely infecting old, vulnerable people? And Democrats are complaining about Trump?

No--A real president wouldn't have been obsessing over his ratings during coronavirus briefings while Americans were dying faster than they could be buried. A real president wouldn't have been spreading lies, disinformation, and false hope. A real president wouldn't have suggested injecting disinfectant as a way to treat people infected with covid-19. A real president wouldn't be pushing untried medicine as a treatment for covid-19. He wouldn't be pushing medication at all. A real president would not have been encouraging armed insurrection in states that were trying to enforce stay-at-home order is to contain the spread of the pandemic.

The original predictions were 1–2 million Americans would be dead. 90k is actually pretty good statistically. If you only know that Donald Trump hosted a reality show, you’re probably too young to be voting for president. Oh, and you should probably review your tv show viewings if you watch reality shows.

We would be sitting at over a million deaths if Hillary were in office. How do we know this? Obama did nothing but appoint a czar for H1N1 - and 60 million people were infected. Translate 60 million people infected with this virus, and what the death toll would look like when it’s done? Upwards of 4 million dead And still most of the dead in a handful of blue states. Why is that?

Time will tell. But looking at different countries around the world I am beginning to wonder how much difference good or bad leadership really makes. Right now it isn't obvious to me that there is a strong correlation. As one British politician put it: if anyone says that they are sure what the right course is in an unprecedented situation is either a liar or a fool. But right now I am not sure that the liars and fools are doing any worse than anyone else.

Yes, in fact I do. The virus doesn't give a crap who the president is, and Democrats trying to pretend that they would have done such an outstanding job handling the crisis certainly doesn't have any basis in reality.

Despite all of the bickering and crying about the current president, the deaths from the virus would still be about where they are at now no matter who is in office, there was too many pre pandemic decisions made by the government from the mayor's, the governor's, the Senate and the house. Decisions were made at all levels that accelerated the spread IE Parades, Mardigras, and Chinese new years celebrations are just a few reasons.
If a Democrat was in office, the number would be higher than that. MUCH higher. That is a fact.
